snippet: The Culture Ministry is introducing migrants from Iraq and Syria to a cultural heritage that happens to include rare treasures from the Middle East.
abstract: Germany is developing programs to adapt its growing population of Middle Eastern asylum seekers to German culture; Multaka, program launched in December 2015, offers free, Arabic-language guided tours of Islamic art, ancient near east and similar collections at Pergamon and other Berlin museums, giving refugees chance to explore their own ancient history and culture in modern European setting.
lead_paragraph: The Culture Ministry is introducing migrants from Iraq and Syria to a cultural heritage that happens to include rare treasures from the Middle East.

headline.main: Berlin’s Museum Tours in Arabic Forge a Bridge to Refugees
headline.print_headline: Beholding Mideast Wonders, as Arab Refugees in Germany
